heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 26 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 3809 lux) and cloud levels (up 314 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 4929 lux) and cloud levels (up 221 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 314.1m lower than yesterday, 100.9m lower than the past week, 220.7m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 845m and a peak of 2560m, averaging 1090.2m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and very little to no wind will be present. Drizzle or light rain possible, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and the light is absent. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (88%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
